briefTitle: Safety and Efficacy of Turoctocog Alfa in Previously Treated Male Children With Haemophilia A

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Male patients with severe (baseline FVIII less than or equal to 1%) haemophilia A
* Age below 12 years and weight at least 11 kg

Exclusion Criteria:

* Surgery planned to occur during trial participation (exceptions are port placement, dental extractions, and minor, uncomplicated emergent procedures)
* Congenital or acquired coagulation disorders other than haemophilia A
* Any history of FVIII inhibitors (greater than or equal to 0.6 BU/mL)

outcomeMeasures.title: The Incidence Rate of FVIII Inhibitors (Greater Than or Equal to 0.6 Bethesda Units (BU))
outcomeMeasures.description: The incidence rate of FVIII inhibitors was calculated by including all patients with inhibitors in the nominator and including all patients with a minimum 50 exposure plus any patients with less than 50 exposures but with inhibitors in denominator.

outcomeMeasures.title: Frequency of Adverse Events (AEs)
outcomeMeasures.description: Adverse event was defined as events occurring after administration of trial product. Severe AEs: considerable interference with subject's daily activities, unacceptable. Moderate AEs: Marked symptoms, moderate interference with the patient's daily activities. Mild AEs: No or transient symptoms, no interference with the patient's daily activities. Serious AE: AE that at any dose results in any of the following: death, a life-threatening experience, in-subject hospitalization/prolongation of existing hospitalisation, persistent/significant disability/incapacity/congenital anomaly/birth defect.
